text:
Cathie Wood is basically saying the market is valuing $TSLA as a future autonomy platform where robotaxis turn one-time vehicle sales into recurring, software-like revenue with ~70% margins.

She also argues a trillion-dollar SpaceX IPO makes sense if you view the space as the next infrastructure buildout with orbital compute & space-based data centers forming a new internet layer

Fibonacci levels help you see where momentum pauses by mapping potential areas of support & resistance using ratios from the Fib sequence.  

I find them useful because strong trends often consolidate at these levels before continuing higher & this list reflects names consolidating between the 0.382  & 0.618 extension levels.

Sam Altman (Oct 2024): ‚ÄúI kind of think of ads as a last resort for us as a business model.‚Äù

OpenAI (Jan 2026): ‚ÄúWe are starting to test ads in ChatGPT free and Go (new $8/month option) tiers.‚Äù

This is a response to distribution reality that $GOOGL Gemini lives where questions already happen across Search, Chrome, Android & Workspace so as AI usage becomes routine the surface that owns attention captures the economics.

Ads weren‚Äôt OpenAI‚Äôs choice but they were the consequence of competing with a model that ships inside the internet itself.

Stanley Druckenmiller: ‚ÄúI like putting all my eggs in one basket.‚Äù

If you really know what you own, what would break the thesis & when you‚Äôd be wrong then concentration is where the real compounding actually comes from.

That‚Äôs why I went into 2026 with ~25% of my growth portfolio in $RKLB & $ASTS since this will be the year of space.

FUTURUM EQUITIES PODCAST EPISODE #27

Daniel & I dove into four big themes:

1. $TSM earnings reset the AI narrative. 
When the company that actually builds the silicon says demand is still outrunning supply then it confirms AI is already a real business with real demand. We break down what that means for the AI Utility trade in $IREN, $NBIS & $CIFR.

2. A SpaceX IPO would force a repricing of space infrastructure. 
That has major implications for $RKLB building end-to-end space logistics, $ASTS turning space into a global cellular network & $PL monetizing continuous Earth data from orbit.

3. Is SaaS actually dead or has the bar just moved?
We discuss whether software rebounds or whether the AI economy shifts the requirement from ‚Äúgood product with recurring revenue‚Äù to owning a true control point in an autonomous world.‚Äù

4. The next AI bottleneck nobody is talking about. 
A setup emerging in 2026 that looks strikingly similar to what we saw in $MU in 2025.

Plus a 10-minute live Q&A at the end.

Watch the full episode at the link below ‚§µÔ∏è
$ADBE PEG is ~1.4 so it doesn‚Äôt exactly scream ‚Äúmust-buy‚Äù despite how aggressively some are pitching it.

Link below to catch the full episode:

piped.video/ss-KqV7BhFA?si=wAUh‚Ä¶

Going into 2026, I called out that a SpaceX IPO would put the entire $1.8T space economy under the brightest spotlight it has ever had because once the anchor of the sector goes public every layer of the ecosystem gets pulled into the narrative.

That‚Äôs now playing out in $RKLB, $ASTS, $PL & $RDW as investors start underwriting the ecosystem instead of isolated names.

Gotta give @tonyromo credit for calling the entire drive ahead of each play

The proposed Billionaires Tax, cleared last month by the state AG, would levy a 5% excise tax on net worth over $1B as of 1/1/ 2026, affecting about 200 individuals & trusts with $2T in wealth. Idiots like @karaswisher think this is a good idea. Clowns gonna clown.
